Given the temperature profile \\( u(x, T) \\) at time T, can we determine the initial profile \\( u(x, 0) \\) without knowing whether the transformation \\( f(u) \\) was applied?
Explanation: Without knowledge of the initial application of \\( f(u) \\), the exponential transformation might have significantly altered the initial temperature distribution, making it impossible to retrieve \\( u(x, 0) \\) uniquely from \\( u(x, T) \\) without additional information about the use of \\( f(u) \\).
